newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: SOCCER-MOROCCO HIT BACK TO WIN YOUTH CUP OPENER.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-MOROCCO HIT BACK TO WIN YOUTH CUP OPENER.

text.p: African youth champions Morocco overcame an early setback against host nation Malaysia to win the opening game of the World Youth Cup 3-1 on Monday.

Watched by a 30,000 home crowd in a 80,000 capacity stadium just outside Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia seized the lead in the 11th minute when Youssef Safri deflected a free kick by Burhan Azmir past his own goalkeeper.
But Africa's number one team swiftly equalised, with Tarik Sektioui silencing the home fans by side-footing the ball in from six metres after 14 minutes.
A 31st minute strike by defender Khalid Khamma after Mounir Haddaji had evaded the hosts offside trap put the Moroccans in front.
Malaysia were close to salvaging a draw when a late free kick from Gilbert Cassedy grazed the crossbar and, seconds later, Moroccan goalkeeper Tarik El Jarmouni denied Chow Chee Weng.
Aissam Barroudi wrapped up Morocco's victory with a 90th minute strike.
"It was not an easy game," said Moroccan coach Rachid Taoussi. "We were playing the host nation and they will always be highly motivated.
"We had trouble with the weather and the climate -- it is very hot and humid. These are not excuses for our performance, which was generally a good one," he said.
